item.title: Amanda add a quote by Ursula K. LeGuin
item.description: "We read books to find out who we are. What other people, real or imaginary, do and think and feel... is an essential guide to our understanding of what we ourselves are and may become." -- Ursula K. LeGuin

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Eudora Welty
item.description: "My main disappointment was always that a book had to end. And then what? But I don't think I was ever disappointed by the books. I must have been what any author would consider an ideal reader. I felt every pain and pleasure suffered or enjoyed by all the characters. Oh, but I identified!" -- Eudora Welty

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Kathleen Thompson Norris
item.description: "Just the knowledge that a good book is awaiting one at the end of a long day makes that day happier. " -- Kathleen Thompson Norris

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Gene Stratton-Porter
item.description: "If you are lazy, and accept your lot, you may live in it. If you are willing to work, you can write your name anywhere you choose." -- Gene Stratton-Porter
